ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: CFRAME=color] 
      
Specifies a color for the frame, which is the rectangle bounded by the axes.

[Syntax: DATA=SAS-data-set] 
      
Specifies the input data set defining the tree.
Reverses the sorting order for the SORT option.

[Syntax: DESCRIPTION=entry-description] 
      
Specifies a description for the graph in the GOUT= catalog. The default is "Proc Tree Graph Output."

Specifies that the values of the HEIGHT variable are dissimilarities; that is, a large height value
means that the clusters are very dissimilar or far apart.

[Syntax: DOCK=n] 
      
Causes observations in the OUT= data set assigned to output clusters with a frequency of n or less
to be given missing values for the output variables CLUSTER and CLUSNAME.

[Syntax: FILLCHAR=’c’] 
      
Specifies the character to display between leaves that are not joined into a cluster.

[Syntax: GOUT=<libref.>member-name] 
      
Specifies the catalog in which the generated graph is stored. The default is WORK.GSEG.

[Syntax: HAXIS=AXISn] 
      
Specifies that the AXIS statement used to customize the appearance of the horizontal axis.
Specifies certain conventional variables to be used for the height axis of the tree diagram.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Defines the height of each node as its path length from the root.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that the graph be oriented horizontally, with the leaf nodes on the right side, 
when the HORIZONTAL option is also specified.
Displays the tree diagram with the height axis oriented horizontally.

[Syntax: HPAGES=n1] 
      
Specifies that the original graph be enlarged to cover n1 pages.

[Syntax: INC=n] 
      
Specifies the increment between tick values on the height axis.

[Syntax: JOINCHAR=’c’] 
      
Specifies the character displayed between leaves that are joined into a cluster.

[Syntax: LEAFCHAR=’c’] 
      
Specifies the character used to represent clusters having no children.

[Syntax: LEVEL=n] 
      
Specifies the level of the tree defining disjoint clusters for the OUT= data set.
Specifies that the tree diagram be displayed using line printer graphics.

Syntax: LINES=( <COLOR=color> <WIDTH=n> <DOTS>)
      
Specifies the color and the thickness of the lines of the tree, and whether a dot is drawn at 
each leaf node.
Lists all the nodes in the tree, displaying the height, parent, and children of each node.

[Syntax: MAXHEIGHT=n] 
      
Specifies the maximum value displayed on the height axis.

[Syntax: MINHEIGHT=n] 
      
Specifies the minimum value displayed on the height axis.

[Syntax: NAME=name] 
      
Specifies the entry name for the generated graph in the GOUT= catalog.

[Syntax: NCLUSTERS=n] 
      
Specifies the number of clusters desired in the OUT= data set.

[Syntax: NTICK=n] 
      
Specifies the number of tick intervals on the height axis.
Suppresses the display of the tree.

[Syntax: OUT=SAS-data-set] 
      
Creates an output data set containing one observation for each object in the tree or subtree 
being processed and variables called CLUSTER and CLUSNAME showing cluster membership at any 
specified level in the tree.

[Syntax: PAGES=n] 
      
Specifies the number of pages over which the tree diagram (from root to leaves) is to extend. 
The default is 1.

[Syntax: POS=n] 
      
Specifies the number of column positions on the height axis.

[Syntax: ROOT=’name’] 
      
Specifies the value of the NAME variable for the root of a subtree to be displayed if you do not 
want to display the entire tree.

Specifies that the values of the HEIGHT variable represent similarities; that is, a large height 
value means that the clusters are very similar or close together.
Sorts the children of each node by the HEIGHT variable, in the order of cluster formation.

[Syntax: SPACES=s] 
      
Specifies the number of spaces between objects in the output.

[Syntax: TICKPOS=n] 
      
Specifies the number of column positions per tick interval on the height axis.

[Syntax: TREECHAR=’c’] 
      
Specifies the character used to represent clusters with children.

[Syntax: VAXIS=AXISn] 
      
Specifies that the AXIS statement be used to customize the appearance of the vertical axis.

[Syntax: VPAGES=n2] 
      
Specifies that the original graph be enlarged to cover n2 pages.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: BY <DESCENDING> variable-1 <...<DESCENDING> variable-n> <NOTSORTED>; 
      
Obtains separate analyses on observations in groups defined by the BY variables.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately follows the word
DESCENDING in the BY statement.
Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.
